title: Predominant lung cDC2 phenotype in cigarette smoke-exposed mice favors polarization of IL-17-producing CD4
abstract: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) is characterized by a deficiency within the lungs of regulatory T cells and an excess of Th17 cells, termed T17/Treg imbalance. Conventional dendritic cells type-1 (cDC1) and type-2 (cDC2) are known to drive Treg and Th17 polarization, respectively, but their roles in COPD are incompletely understood.
